frame.name: Being_in_effect
frame.definition: A particular Binding_principle is (or is not) operative, that is, any obligations, restrictions, and any other aspects of the Binding_principle are (or are not) in effect. The Binding_principle can be expressed as being in effect for a particular Duration, or at a particular Time or Place, or under certain Circumstances. This law will only become in effect during the last three weeks of the year. The statutory wetlands definition is effective immediately. This contract is binding on all parties. Although the in effect is properly in this frame, (put) into effect is analyzed in the Execute_plan frame. This is in part because to put an (evacuation) plan into effect is to actually execute the plan (to evacuate), while to put a plan in effect is to determine that in the future the plan may have to executed, i.e., to make the plan binding. Similar observations can be made for come into effect.

FE.name: Binding_principle
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is the law, contract, principle, or other (set of) obligations that is (or is not) operational.
<ex>Once <fex name="bin_pri">the treaty</fex> is in <t>effect</t>, US port authorities and the Coast Guard will monitor compliance by checking any yacht 79 feet or longer.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time for which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is or is not in effect.
<ex>The contract will be <t>effective</t><fex name="dur">for three fiscal years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is in effect.
<ex>All patent applicants and owners should be aware of the current uncertainty as to what patent fees will be in <t>effect</t> <fex name="tim">on October 1, 1998</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is or is not operational.
<ex>This promotion is <t>void</t> <fex name="pla">in the state of Florida</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs under which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is/isn't operational.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A cause, reason, or other explanation for the status of the <fen>Binding_principle</fen>
<ex>Your contract is <t>null</t> <fex name="exp">because you left the county</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Obligated_party
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group who is obligated to follow the <fen>Binding_principle</fen>.
<ex>This statute is in <t>effect</t> <fex name="obl">for holders of H-1 visas</fex> until January.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: effective.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a law or policy) operative.

lexUnit.name: effect.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (with in or into) the state or quality of being operational or effective.

lexUnit.name: force.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (with in or into) state or quality of being in effect.

lexUnit.name: void.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not valid or legally binding.

lexUnit.name: null.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having no legal force; invalid.

lexUnit.name: binding.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: (especially of contracts) having legal force.
